newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia to vet election speeches on TV, radio.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia to vet election speeches on TV, radio.

text.p: The Indonesian government will vet speeches given by political parties over television and radio in the campaign leading to May 29 general elections, an election commission spokesman said on Wednesday.

"A team which includes officials from the Home Affairs and Information Ministries will screen the speeches before they are broadcast by the TVRI television network and the RRI radio station," he told Reuters.
The speeches should not attack the government and they should merely contain the programmes of the respective political parties, he said.
Political speeches originate on state television and radio and are only relayed by private channels.

The commission spokesman said the order was sent on Tuesday to the three parties legally permitted to contest the national and local elections, the ruling Golkar, the Moslem-based United Development Party (PPP) and the Christian-Nationalist Indonesian Democratic Party (PDI).
The broadcast regulation is the latest in a series of restrictions for the election campaign which runs from April 27 to May 23, followed by a cooling off period before the polls are held.
